newsitem.title: USA: Pfizer ends marketing deal with Xoma.
newsitem.headline: Pfizer ends marketing deal with Xoma.

text.p: Xoma Corp said Monday its partner Pfizer Inc decided to terminate its marketing agreement for Xoma's E5 monoclonal antibody product.
As a result, Xoma said it will no longer be seeking approval of the product in Japan, unless another interested partner comes forward.

In April, Xoma discontinued U.S. trials of its E5 monoclonal antibody, a sepsis treatment, because it failed to show statistically significant efficacy in treating patients. At the time, however, the company had said it planned to pursue approval of the drug in Japan, where the burden of proof in demonstrating efficacy is lighter than in the U.S. With Pfizer's decision to exit the agreement, the Japanese application is on hold indefinitely.
"I suspect that they decided (Japan) was too small a market to pursue," a Xoma spokeswoman said of Pfizer's termination of the deal.
Pfizer had been the exclusive licensee for E5 in the U.S. and Japan. Those rights now revert back to Xoma. Xoma said it expects no significant financial or operational impact from Pfizer's decision.
